turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Pterelaus (son of Lelex).
turn.1: What can you tell me about Pterelaus?
turn.2: Pterelaus (son of Lelex) In Greek mythology, Pterelaus (; Ancient Greek: Πτερέλαος) was the son of Lelex, the pre-Hellenic king of Megara whose descendants (the Leleges) spread across Greece and beyond.
turn.3: Who were some of his brethren?
turn.4: Thus, he was the possible brother of Bias and Cleson.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Pterelaus ruled the land by the River Achelous, in the region later called Acarnania.
turn.8: Pterelaus had numerous sons who settled the territory in the vicinity of the Achelous, including the nearby islands of the Ionian Sea.
turn.9: What were some of his sons' names?
turn.10: His sons Ithacus, Neritus, and Polyctor colonized the island of Ithaca (which took the name of one of his sons) and, in addition to Ithaca itself, founded the places on Ithaca named Neritum and Polyctorium.
turn.11: Did he have any other sons?
turn.12: Taphius and Teleboas were also numbered among Pterelaus's sons, and founded the Taphian and Teleboan tribes.
